page.title: 11Coming to Bwlch-y-groes (1)
page.content: In the early 1970's we were becoming dissatisfied with the relentless pursuit of progress which had meant moving every few years.The continued upheaval was bad for the children,the urban environment oppressive.We decided to opt out,buy a house with a little land and aim for a degree of self-sufficiency.Back to the Simple Life!It soon became apparent that others had the same idea,and that the simple life in England was far beyond our means.We turned to Wales where property was cheaper.The North was beautiful but bleak and rather foreign,so we looked to the South.Pure chance led us to Bwlch-y-groes but we loved it on sight and in 1979 we arrived,after five years of effort.The obvious difference is the language,but that is not the whole story,though it is the key to the area's character.
